page.title: 15Health Care in Stevington
page.content: Most people rely on the National Health Service for their medical care and are attached to group practices in Harrold or Bedford.Surgeries are held morning and evening but as the bus service is sparse,private transport is necessary for keeping appointments. Doctors will make house calls on those too ill to travel.Patients needing care at home will be visited by a district nurse who will also look after maternity cases before and after confinement.Stevington women usually have their babies in Bedford Hospital. The ambulance service is available in cases of emergency and also for taking patients receiving long-term treatment who cannot transport themselves.There is a wide choice of dentists and opticians in Bedford working privately and under the N.H.S.The mobile baby and foot clinics visit monthly.
